meanings.definition: To make or become dull or discolored
meanings.sent1: Leaving silver jewelry out can lead to tarnishing over time.
meanings.sent2: The metal started tarnishing after being exposed to moisture.
meanings.sent3: The sun seemed to enjoy tarnishing the once shiny surface of the car.
meanings.sent4: Neglecting to clean the mirror regularly resulted in a tarnishing effect on its reflection.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a special chemical to create a tarnishing effect on the painting for a vintage look.

meanings.definition: To damage or harm the reputation of
meanings.sent1: Gossiping can be hurtful, tarnishing friendships.
meanings.sent2: The false accusations were tarnishing his good name in the community.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous rumor about the principal tarnishing his image turned out to be a prank.
meanings.sent4: The scandal had a tarnishing impact on the company's public image.
meanings.sent5: The politician's dishonesty was tarnishing his credibility among voters.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming dull or discolored
meanings.sent1: The tarnishing of the metal was noticeable after years of neglect.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the gradual tarnishing of the antique vase on the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The sudden rainstorm caused a rapid tarnishing of the freshly painted fence.
meanings.sent4: The artist captured the beauty in the tarnishing of the old building's facade.
meanings.sent5: The slow tarnishing of the statue's bronze surface added character to its appearance.
